DataElement.preferredName: NCCN Guidelines Distress Management Thermometer Screening Tool Version 1.2011 Past Week Distress Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how distressed they have been during the past week, using an eleven point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: NCCN Guidelines Distress Management Thermometer Screening Tool Version 1.2011 Past Week Distress Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single-item question screening tool developed by the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress Management Panel used to identify patient distress coming from any source._A question about an individual's level of distress during the past week._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: NCCN Guidelines Distress Management Distress Thermometer Screening Tool Version 1.2011
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A single-item question screening tool developed by the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress Management Panel used to identify patient distress coming from any source.

Concepts.longName: NCCN Guidelines Distress Management Distress Thermometer Screening Tool Version 1.2011
Concepts.definition: A single-item question screening tool developed by the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress Management Panel used to identify patient distress coming from any source.

Property.preferredName: Distressed During the Past Week on a Scale of 0 to 10 Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's level of distress during the past week.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Distressed During the Past Week on a Scale of 0 to 10
Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's level of distress during the past week.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NHC for study in Rave per request by G.Hartley-Deen. mc 6/27/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A score of 1 on an eleven-point Likert scale from no distress to extreme distress.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A score of 1 on an eleven-point Likert scale from no distress to extreme distress.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: The highest degree of severity.: A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.: A subjective score of 1 on a Likert scale.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The highest degree of severity.
A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A subjective score of 1 on a Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The highest degree of severity.: A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: First, please circle the numb
ReferenceDocuments.description: First, please circle the number (0-10) that best describes how much distress you have been experiencing in the past week including today.
